ref: 8097 *pāyakka ʻ foot soldier ʼ. [← Ir. cf. Pahl. paik, Pers. paig J. Charpentier Oriental Studies in honour of C. E. Pavry 78 with lit. (Pischel GrPk 141 wrongly < pādātika -- ). MIA. form sanskritized as pāyika -- m. lex.]
H. pāyak, pāik m. ʻ footsoldier, messenger ʼ;
M. pāīk m. ʻ petty village official, armed attendant ʼ.
